content: - quote: There is a moment in the life of most former world leaders when the reality of losing office finally hits home. For George W Bush that moment came when Barney the dog made an unwelcome deposit on a neighbourhood pavement. *http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2009/may/22/george-bush-dog-mess Okay, while this article is kinda funny, it does suggest one thing of some serious note in the last sentence: did Bush ever truly want the job? - -

content: quote: Originally posted by ACR26: Ya know...we already have several of you...can't you just...go away? You must feel so lack luster in life knowing you got this new Admin who (only at night) will you admit is sucking Huh? It's an amusing story, with, for me, a quite important commentary at the end. Most former presidents and (vice presidents at the moment) don't 'go quietly'. No, they yap and carry on and get their beaks into all sorts of stuff. They hate that their power is over. But not GW. He seems genuinely happy to be a regular citizen again. So the question remains; did he ever truly, deep down, want the CINC job in the first place? It's a valid question. -
quote: Originally posted by ACR26: Ya know...we already have several of you...can't you just...go away? You must feel so lack luster in life knowing you got this new Admin who (only at night) will you admit is sucking
reply: Huh? It's an amusing story, with, for me, a quite important commentary at the end. Most former presidents and (vice presidents at the moment) don't 'go quietly'. No, they yap and carry on and get their beaks into all sorts of stuff. They hate that their power is over. But not GW. He seems genuinely happy to be a regular citizen again. So the question remains; did he ever truly, deep down, want the CINC job in the first place? It's a valid question. -
title: Bush and his pooper-scooper

content: He wanted the job, accomplished what he wanted, and is now relieved to be rid of the responsibility of the rest of the "stuff" that went with it...

content: quote: Originally posted by Tower_Flower: He wanted the job, accomplished what he wanted, and is now relieved to be rid of the responsibility of the rest of the "stuff" that went with it...
